definition-item.definition-title: CHEMICAL FEATURES IN THE MANUFACTURE OF ARTIFICIAL FILAMENTS, THREADS, FIBRES, BRISTLES OR RIBBONS; APPARATUS SPECIALLY ADAPTED FOR THE MANUFACTURE OF CARBON FILAMENTS

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Chemistry-related aspects in the manufacture of artificial fibres, filaments and similar. It also covers - the chemical treatment of fibres and filaments during their production, e.g. before winding,
Apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture of carbon filaments is also covered.
Many documents in the field disclose features related to both the mechanical (D01D) and the chemical (D01F) aspect of fibre manufacture. Two cases can be envisaged:

a) When a document is concerned with mechanical aspects but mentions specific polymers, classification should always be given in D01D and classification may be added in D01F when the chemical aspects are relevant or non-usual polymers or additives are used. No D01F classification should be given when a long list of polymers is mentioned, even when in the claims.

b) When a document is concerned with chemical aspects but mentions specific techniques (e.g. melt-blowing, electrospinning) classification should always be given in D01F and classification may be added in D01D when the specific technique plays an important role. No D01D classification should be given when several unrelated techniques are mentioned, even when in the claims.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Synthetic grass, lawns for playground or sports grounds
Continuous casting of metals, i.e. casting in indefinite lengths
Treatment of metallic powder characterized by its shape or structure, e.g. fibre structure
Shaping composites, i.e. plastics material comprising reinforcements, fillers, or preformed parts
Manufacture of articles or shaped materials containing macromolecular substances
Recycling or recovering of waste materials
Crimping or curling fibres, filaments, threads, or yarns
Yarns or threads; Processes or apparatus for the production thereof, not otherwise provided for
Finishing or dressing of filaments, yarns, threads, cords, ropes or the like
Chemical treatment of fibres after production

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention should be paid when blends or additives are used. These cases are classified in different subgroups and sometimes there is an overlap. As a general rule, additives are characterised by their function (e.g. stabilizer, pigment), whilst polymer blends have different properties compared to the single substances.

In the case where classification is given under D01F1/00 a corresponding group under D01F6/00 should be given when a specific polymer is used. However, no classification should be given under D01F6/00 when a long list of polymers is mentioned.
The table below is an example concerning polyethylene:

table-column.paragraph-text: Polymer blend with additives (homo- or copolymer)

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: relatively short, elongated member of natural or artificial material
endless or quasi-endless, elongated member of natural or artificial material
assembly of yarns or filaments, usually produced by twisting
unitary assembly of fibres, usually produced by spinning

definition-item.definition-title: General methods for the manufacture of artificial filaments or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Addition of additives to the spinning solution or melt.
D01F1/00 covers the chemical nature of the additive, whereas the method of adding the additive, that would be considered to be a mechanical feature, is classified in D01D1/065.

In the case where classification is given under D01F1/00 a corresponding group under D01F6/00 should be given when a specific polymer is used. However, no classification should be given under D01F6/00 when a long list of polymers is mentioned.
When an additive is used in the spinning solution or in the melt, and this additive has none of the specific properties mentioned in the subgroups of D01F1/00, then two cases are envisaged:
when the additive has an effect on the fibre production process (e.g. lubricant, viscosity modifier), the group D01F1/02 should be given;
when the additive has an effect on the final properties of the fibre (e.g. additives for improving the tensile strength), the group D01F1/10 should be given.
Please note that the composition of the spinning solution of viscose is dealt with in D01F2/08 and subgroups.

Under D01F1/09, when an intrinsically electrically conductive additive (e.g. carbon nanotubes) is added for a different purpose (e.g. tensile strength), only the classification related to the desired function should be allocated.

definition-item.definition-title: for making electroconductive or anti-static filaments

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Also covers addition of additives to make antistatic fibres/filaments.

definition-item.definition-title: Monocomponent artificial filaments or the like of cellulose or cellulose derivatives; Manufacture thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Artificial monocomponent fibres or the like of cellulose or its derivatives .
D01F2/00 only covers the production of cellulosic fibres. Fibres from other carbohydrates (e.g. starch, hemicellulose, chitosan, dextran, hyaluronan) are classified in D01F9/00.
Fibres spun from amine oxide solutions (e.g. lyocell) are classified in D01F2/00.

definition-item.definition-title: from solutions of cellulose in acids, bases or salts

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fibres spun from solutions of ionic liquids.

definition-item.definition-title: from viscose

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Composition of the spinning solution or the bath

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Addition to the spinning solution or spinning bath of substances which exert their effect equally well in either

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Addition of substances to the spinning solution or bath, these substances having an effect on the solution, on the bath or on the final fibre.

definition-item.definition-title: from cellulose derivatives

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Cellulose carbamate fibres.

definition-item.definition-title: Monocomponent artificial filaments or the like of proteins; Manufacture thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Monocomponent fibres or the like of proteins.

When a polyaminoacid or a polypeptide is obtained synthetically, classification in D01F6/68 should be given. Fibres from natural proteins are classified in D01F4/00, even when the protein has been chemically modified.

definition-item.definition-title: Monocomponent artificial filaments or the like of synthetic polymers; Manufacture thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Monocomponent fibres or the like of synthetic polymers.

This group is divided in two main sections based on the type of polymer used. The first part relates to polyaddition polymers and the second part to polycondensation polymers. In turn, for each type of polymers a distinction is made between homopolymers, copolymers and blended polymers. When a document covers both homo- and copolymers the homopolymer group is always allocated, and the copolymer group is only allocated when specific information is given about the copolymer (e.g. type and amount of comonomers).

All fibres comprising 35-85% of acrylonitrile are classified in D01F6/40 even if the fibres are not defined as modacrylic. If an overlap exists on the amount of acrylonitrile both classifications should be allocated.
Although the polyurethanes used to make fibres are normally copolymers, elastic polyurethane fibres are always classified in this subgroup

definition-item.definition-title: from polyolefins

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Polyolefins in general.

definition-item.definition-title: from polypropylene

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Polypropene.

definition-item.definition-title: from polymers of cyclic compounds with one carbon-to-carbon double bond in the side chain

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Polyvinylpyrrolidone fibres.

definition-item.definition-title: from polymers of aliphatic compounds with more than one carbon-to-carbon double bond

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Polydienes

definition-item.definition-title: from copolymers obtained by reactions only involving carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Polyketone fibres.

definition-item.definition-title: {derived from hydroxy-carboxylic acids, e.g. lactones}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Poly(lactic acid) fibres, including the polymers of racemic mixtures of D- and L-acid.

definition-item.definition-title: from polycondensates of cyclic compounds, e.g. polyimides, polybenzimidazoles

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Polybenzazole/polybenzoxazole fibres.

definition-item.definition-title: from other polycondensation products

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Polyaniline fibres.

definition-item.definition-title: Conjugated, i.e. bi- or multicomponent, artificial filaments or the like; Manufacture thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Multicomponent, i.e. conjugated, fibres or the like such as core-sheath, side-by-side, islands-in the sea, etc.

Documents concerning multicomponent fibres should be classified under D01F8/00 if the chemical aspects are important (e.g. the materials used) and in D01D5/30 - D01D5/36 when the mechanical aspects are important (e.g. the spinneret or the method used).

The coating of fibres or filaments is classified in D01F13/00 (if the coating happens during production, covering chemical aspects), D01D11/06 (if the coating happens during production, covering mechanical aspects), D06M (if the coating happens after production, covering chemical aspects), or D02J (if the coating happens after production, covering mechanical aspects).

definition-item.definition-title: Artificial filaments or the like of other substances; Manufacture thereof; Apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture of carbon filaments

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Man-made filaments or the like of other substances that are not comprised in any of the above groups.
Also covers apparatus for manufacturing carbon fibres.
Carbon nanofibers vs nanotubes:

Carbon nanotubes are classified in C01B32/15. However, sometimes a document uses the term "nanofiber" as a broad term including nanotubes. In these cases, the description should be checked, and classification under D01F should not be given if the document appears to actually relate to nanotubes only. Yarns of carbon nanotubes/nanofibres are classified under D01F9/00 when the chemical aspects are important, and under D02G3/00 when the mechanical aspects are important. In case of doubt, classification under both groups should be given.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: of inorganic material (working or processing of metal wire B21F; from softened glass, minerals or slags C03B37/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Working or processing of metal wire
Manufacture of fibres or filaments from softened glass, minerals or slags

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Processing inorganic compounds to obtain ceramic fibres
Incandescent bodies; Manufacture of incandescent bodies

definition-item.definition-title: Carbon filaments; Apparatus specially adapted for the manufacture thereof

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Nanosized carbon materials having a fullerene structure

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus for manufacturing vapor-grown carbon fibres.

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus therefor

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus for manufacturing carbon fibres obtained by carbonization of organic filaments.

definition-item.definition-title: Chemical after-treatment of artificial filaments or the like during manufacture

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Chemical treatment of filaments and the like during their manufacture, i.e. during a continuous production process before the filaments have been collected.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Surface treatment of fibres or filaments made from glass, minerals or slags
Surface treatment of fibres or filaments made from ceramics
Mechanical aspects in coating with a spinning solution or melt during the manufacture
Dry-Cleaning, washing or bleaching fibres, filaments, threads, yarns, fabrics, feathers or made-up fibrous goods; Bleaching leather or furs
Finishing; Treatment not provided for elsewhere of fibres, threads, yarns, fabrics, feathers or fibrous goods made therefrom
Dyeing or Printing textile; Dyeing leather, furs or solid macromolecular substances in any form

section-body.paragraph-text: Chemical treatment is not limited to reactive treatments, but is considered to encompass any treatment with a chemical substance, e.g. coating with a solution.

definition-item.definition-title: Recovery of starting material, waste material or solvents during the manufacture of artificial filaments or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Recovery of starting material, waste material or solvents during the manufacture of artificial filaments or the like.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Chemical aspects in the recycling of plastic
